Description: Section of the upper body of a red-orange pottery wine-jar (ostracon), the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and faint remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as year 14 wine of the Aten domain from the western river.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393525) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393525)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Domain of Aten
